gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem

Class AbstractTerm

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem.AbstractTerm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SemanticItem, Term, java.lang.Comparable<SemanticItem>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Entity, Predicate

    public abstract class AbstractTerm
extends java.lang.Object
implements Term
    The basic implementation of an atomic semantic object, Term.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Gets the string of the term mention, from its span. If the term corresponds to a gapped textual unit, it will return the strings of these contiguous units separated by a space.
        Specified by:
        getText in interface Term
        Returns:
        the text associated with the term

      • getSubsumingText

        public java.lang.String getSubsumingText()
        Gets the text of the subsuming textual unit.

        The difference between this method and #getText() is that this method will simply return the associated textual unit's text. For example, the prognosis may have two terms associated with it, a coreferential mention associated with the full phrase, and a predicate associated with prognosis only.

        If one wants to get prognosis only for the predicate term, getText should be used instead.

        Returns:
        the text associated with the textual unit that subsumes this term

      • toStandoffAnnotation

        public java.lang.String toStandoffAnnotation()
        Returns the standoff annotation text for this term.

        The standoff annotation for a term is (tabs after ID and before TEXT). [ID] [TYPE] [SPAN] [TEXT]

        Specified by:
        toStandoffAnnotation in interface SemanticItem
        Returns:
        the string representation in standoff annotation format
